page.title: 04 INGESTRE CHURCH
page.content: The present church of St. Mary the Virgin had been built to the design of Sir Christopher Wren in 1671. Inside the church there are many stained glass windows. Many of these had been added when Walter Chetwynd built the church in 1671, but four of the windows are made of stained glass from the earlier church. Walter Chetwynd had requested from the d Archbishop to build the church which was under the controversy.The petition which was sent was signed by three friends of Chetwynd and only one parishioner. The religion of Ingestre Church is C.of E.The minister is the Reverend E.Townsend,unless there is either a funeral,marrriage or baptism.There are many inscriptions refering to the past Earls of Shrewsbury.
